Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Anklet
Description: Forty-five disc-shaped beads made of white ostrich eggshell, together with a central bead, disc-shaped with a rounded edge and made of translucent orange-coloured carnelian. It adorned the right ankle of a deceased of the C-Group. This piece of jewellery is representative of the tastes and skills of the artisans of this Lower Nubian culture.
